DataElement.preferredName: Imaging Procedure Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response as to whether a patient meets the criteria for enrolling onto a clinical trial for questions related to imaging and the act of dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agents as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Imaging Technique Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has CT or MRI been done withi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has CT or MRI been done within 14 days prior to start of study and corticosteroid dose has been stable or decreasing for at least 5 days prior to scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has CT or MRI been done within 14 days prior to start of study and corticosteroid dose has been stable or decreasing for at least 5 days prior to baseline MRI scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -  2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has a radiotracer been administered within 5 half-lives prior to the date of 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT imaging?
